column4: does anyone know how to reinstall the ubuntu-desktop without an internet connection?
i don't have a gui at all. I only have command line. And I'm unfamiliar with command line
can anyone tell me how to find a particular file from command line, regardless of what directory it is in?
thanks... but both of those don't seem to work... grep just seems to suspend me, and find doesn't seem to probe subdirectories
well when i type grep *.ko from the / directory then it just drops the cursor to the next line and doesn't seem to do anything else...
that's why you need to do find.  See, *s are interpreted by bash, not grep

i've tried the same thing with find... find *.ko and it reports instantly that there is no such file... when i try searching for something that i know is in a subdirectory (such as bin/sh) from the / directory, it still tells me no such file...
.ko is the right extension for a module right? ie 8712.ko?

thanks for the help... unfortunately it seems that since i am running in "safe mode" the module i need, doesn't seem to be present... is there a way for me to download the ubuntu-desktop package onto a thumbdrive and then use that to install the desktop on the other computer?
I don't know.  Maybe you could just install the alternate cd to the usb
